alert.note: Alert for Accomack (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 25 at 7:46PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Accomack County through 830 PM EDT... At 746 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Tylerton to near Lawsonia to 7 miles west of Onancock. Movement was east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Onancock, Parksley, Onley, Accomac, Melfa, Bloxom, Saxis, Hallwood, Horntown, Harborton, Mappsville, Greenbackville, Wallops Island, Temperanceville, Nelsonia, Sanford, Modest Town, Oak Hall, Clam and Guilford. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Strong wind gusts are possible with these storms. These wind gusts are capable of knocking down tree limbs, small or weakened trees, and blowing around trash cans, potted plants, lawn furniture, and other light outdoor objects. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM EDT for southeastern Maryland...and southeastern Virginia.
